message.content: {"id": "47910", "title": "Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF", "description": "When calling ajc with the parameters sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, an output file is created with a .jar extension. However, this file is not a valid jar file because it does not contain a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file. The documentation for ajc suggests that the outjar parameter should put the output classes in a zip file, but it does not seem to be functioning correctly in this case.", "OB": "The output file created by ajc with the outjar parameter does not contain a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file.", "EB": "The outjar parameter should create a valid jar file that includes a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file.", "SR": "ajc should create a valid jar file with a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file when using the outjar parameter."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '47910', 'title': 'Bug 47910ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF', 'description': 'with a METAINF/MANIFEST.MFfile inside. ', 'OB': "Bug 47910ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF I call ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar and an output file is createdwith a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because there is noMANIFEST.MF file. I see that the text for ajc says:outjar <fileput output classes in zip file <filewhich might imply that it is supposed to be a zip file, but a parameter called outjar which creates a zip file doesn't really make sense. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
